DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response that indicates the pathological findings of the submitted specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:The result of an examination or inquiry.:A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:The result of an examination or inquiry.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
The result of an examination or inquiry.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from squamous epithelial cells.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the proliferation of atypical, often pleomorphic squamous cells.  Squamous cell carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated.  Well differentiated carcinomas are usually associated with keratin production and the presence of intercellular bridges between adjacent cells.  Representative examples are lung squamous cell carcinoma, skin squamous cell carcinoma, and cervical squamous cell carcinoma.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from squamous epithelial cells.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the proliferation of atypical, often pleomorphic squamous cells.  Squamous cell carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated.  Well differentiated carcinomas are usually associated with keratin production and the presence of intercellular bridges between adjacent cells.  Representative examples are lung squamous cell carcinoma, skin squamous cell carcinoma, and cervical squamous cell carcinoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Knowledge on which to base belief.: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.: Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Knowledge on which to base belief.
Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.
Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.: A common cancer characterized by the presence of malignant glandular cells.  Morphologically, adenocarcinomas are classified according to the growth pattern (e.g., papillary, alveolar) or according to the secreting product (e.g., mucinous, serous).  Representative examples of adenocarcinoma are ductal and lobular breast carcinoma, lung adenocarcinoma, renal cell carcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma (hepatoma), colon adenocarcinoma, and prostate adenocarcinoma.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A common cancer characterized by the presence of malignant glandular cells.  Morphologically, adenocarcinomas are classified according to the growth pattern (e.g., papillary, alveolar) or according to the secreting product (e.g., mucinous, serous).  Representative examples of adenocarcinoma are ductal and lobular breast carcinoma, lung adenocarcinoma, renal cell carcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma (hepatoma), colon adenocarcinoma, and prostate adenocarcinoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A neoplastic lesion that shows morphologic evidence of invasion into the lamina propria or muscularis mucosa.  There is no evidence of invasion into the submucosa.  Evidence of invasion may refer to stromal invasion by single cells or clusters of cells, presence of atypical and complex glandular architectural patterns beyond those that are present in normal mucosa, desmoplasia, and/or vascular invasion.

Concepts.definition: A neoplastic lesion that shows morphologic evidence of invasion into the lamina propria or muscularis mucosa.  There is no evidence of invasion into the submucosa.  Evidence of invasion may refer to stromal invasion by single cells or clusters of cells, presence of atypical and complex glandular architectural patterns beyond those that are present in normal mucosa, desmoplasia, and/or vascular invasion.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intestinal Metaplasia Low Grade Gastric Intraepithelial Neoplasia

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intestinal Metaplasia Low Grade Gastric Intraepithelial Neoplasia
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.: Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.: A gastric intraepithelial lesion characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells with mild cytologic atypia, mild architectural changes, and low number of mitotic figures.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.
Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.
A gastric intraepithelial lesion characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells with mild cytologic atypia, mild architectural changes, and low number of mitotic figures.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intestinal Metaplasia Negative for Gastric Dysplasia

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intestinal Metaplasia Negative for Gastric Dysplasia
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.: Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.: A morphologic finding indicating the absence of dysplastic changes in the gastric mucosal epithelium.  It includes non-neoplastic inflammatory, reactive, or metaplastic pathologic processes.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.
Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.
A morphologic finding indicating the absence of dysplastic changes in the gastric mucosal epithelium.  It includes non-neoplastic inflammatory, reactive, or metaplastic pathologic processes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intestinal Metaplasia Indefinite for Gastric Dysplasia

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intestinal Metaplasia Indefinite for Gastric Dysplasia
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.: Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.: A term used to describe an ambiguous morphologic pattern in the gastric mucosa, when there is doubt whether the findings represent a non-neoplastic or neoplastic pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.
Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.
A term used to describe an ambiguous morphologic pattern in the gastric mucosa, when there is doubt whether the findings represent a non-neoplastic or neoplastic pathologic process.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intestinal Metaplasia High Grade Gastric Intraepithelial Neoplasia

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intestinal Metaplasia High Grade Gastric Intraepithelial Neoplasia
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.: Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.: A gastric intraepithelial lesion characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells that are cuboidal with a high nucleus to cytoplasmic ratio, prominent nucleoli, significant architectural changes, and increased number of mitotic figures.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.
Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.

A gastric intraepithelial lesion characterized by the presence of neoplastic cells that are cuboidal with a high nucleus to cytoplasmic ratio, prominent nucleoli, significant architectural changes, and increased number of mitotic figures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
